verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> ye the word<WH1697> which Jehovah<WH3068> speaketh<WH1696> unto you<WH1004>, O house of Israel<WH3478>:

thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Learn<WH3925> not the way<WH1870> of the nations<WH1471>, and be not dismayed<WH2865> at the signs<WH226> of heaven<WH8064>; for the nations<WH1471> are dismayed<WH2865> at them<WH1992>.

For the customs<WH2708> of the peoples<WH5971> are vanity<WH1892>; for one cutteth<WH3772> a tree<WH6086> out of the forest<WH3293>, the work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of the workman<WH2796> with the axe<WH4621>.
They deck<WH3302> it with silver<WH3701> and with gold<WH2091>; they fasten<WH2388> it with nails<WH4548> and with hammers<WH4717>, that it move not<WH6328>.

They are like<WH4749> a palm-tree<WH8560>, of turned work<WH1696>, and speak not<WH5375>: they must needs be borne<WH5375>, because they cannot go<WH6805>. Be not afraid<WH3372> of them<WH7489>; for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good<WH3190>.
There is none like unto thee<WH3068>, O Jehovah; thou art great<WH1419>, and thy name<WH8034> is great<WH1419> in might<WH1369>.

Who should not fear<WH3372> thee<WH4428>, O King of the nations<WH1471>? for to thee doth it appertain<WH2969>; forasmuch as among all the wise<WH2450> men of the nations<WH1471>, and in all their royal estate<WH4438>, there is none like unto thee.
But they are together<WH259> brutish<WH1197> and foolish<WH3688>: the instruction<WH4148> of idols<WH6086>! it is but a stock<WH6086>.

There is silver<WH3701> beaten into plates<WH7554>, which is brought<WH935> from Tarshish<WH8659>, and gold<WH2091> from Uphaz<WH210>, the work<WH4639> of the artificer<WH2796> and of the hands<WH3027> of the goldsmith<WH6884>; blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> for their clothing<WH3830>; they are all the work<WH4639> of skilful men<WH2450>.

But Jehovah<WH3068> is the true<WH571> God<WH430>; he is the living<WH2416> God<WH430>, and an everlasting<WH5769> King<WH4428>: at his wrath<WH7110> the earth<WH776> trembleth<WH7493>, and the nations<WH1471> are not able to abide<WH3557> his indignation<WH2195>.

Thus <WH1836> shall ye say<WH560> unto them<WH426>, The gods that have not<WH3809> made<WH5648> the heavens<WH8065> and the earth<WH778>, these shall perish<WH7> from the earth<WH772>, and from under<WH8460> the<WH429> heavens<WH8065>.

He hath made<WH6213> the earth<WH776> by his power<WH3581>, he hath established<WH3559> the world<WH8398> by his wisdom<WH2451>, and by his understanding<WH2451> hath he stretched out<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064>:

when he uttereth<WH5414> his voice<WH6963>, there is a tumult<WH1995> of waters<WH4325> in the heavens<WH8064>, and he causeth the vapors<WH5387> to ascend<WH5927> from the ends<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>; he maketh<WH6213> lightnings<WH1300> for the rain<WH4306>, and bringeth forth<WH3318> the wind<WH7307> out of his treasuries<WH214>.

Every man<WH120> is become brutish<WH1197> and is without knowledge<WH1847>; every goldsmith<WH6884> is put to shame<WH3001> by his graven image<WH5262>; for his molten image<WH5262> is falsehood<WH8267>, and there is no breath in them<WH7307>.
They are vanity<WH1892>, a work<WH4639> of delusion<WH8595>: in the time<WH6256> of their visitation<WH6486> they shall perish<WH6>.

The portion<WH2506> of Jacob<WH3290> is not like these<WH3335>; for he is the former of all things<WH3478>; and Israel is the tribe<WH7626> of his inheritance<WH5159>: Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>.
Gather up<WH622> thy wares<WH3666> out of the land<WH776>, O thou that abidest<WH3427> in the siege<WH4692>.
For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Behold<WH7049>, I will sling out the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> at this time<WH6471>, and will distress<WH6887> them<WH4672>, that they may feel it.
Woe <WH188> is me because of my hurt<WH7667>! my wound<WH4347> is grievous<WH2470>: but I said<WH559>, Truly<WH389> this is my grief<WH2483>, and I must bear it<WH5375>.

My tent<WH168> is destroyed<WH7703>, and all my cords<WH4340> are broken<WH5423>: my children<WH1121> are gone forth<WH3318> from me<WH5186>, and they are not: there is none to spread my tent<WH168> any more<WH6965>, and to set up my curtains<WH3407>.
For the shepherds<WH7462> are become brutish<WH1197>, and have not inquired<WH1875> of Jehovah<WH3068>: therefore they have not prospered<WH7919>, and all their flocks<WH4830> are scattered<WH6327>.

The voice<WH6963> of tidings<WH8052>, behold<WH935>, it cometh, and a great<WH1419> commotion<WH7494> out of the north<WH6828> country<WH776>, to make<WH7760> the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063> a desolation<WH8077>, a dwelling-place<WH4583> of jackals<WH8577>.
O Jehovah<WH3068>, I know<WH3045> that the way<WH1870> of man<WH120> is not in himself<WH376>: it is not in man that walketh<WH1980> to direct<WH3559> his steps<WH6806>.
O Jehovah<WH3068>, correct<WH3256> me<WH4941>, but in measure: not in thine anger<WH639>, lest thou bring me to nothing<WH4591>.

Pour out<WH8210> thy wrath<WH2534> upon the nations<WH1471> that know<WH3045> thee not<WH4940>, and upon the families that call<WH7121> not on thy name<WH8034>: for they have devoured<WH398> Jacob<WH3290>, yea<WH398>, they have devoured him and consumed<WH3615> him<WH8074>, and have laid waste his habitation<WH5116>.
